After struggling they literally became popular overnight. Western artists want to collaborate with them. Namjoon has already collaborated with several western artists and there's actually a list now. Their CEO is savvy, smart and talented and has promoted them western style rather than the Korean way, allowing the members to write, produce, and choreograph. Soon, they will also be directing their music videos. Koreans who are into Kpop take stanning a group quite seriously. It's frowned upon to be a multi-group fan. If you try to join multiple fan clubs and you are found out, often you are banned permanently from both fandoms. If you are a member of a fan club, you are expected to be all in. Other fandoms, 2 in particular, don't like that BTS is so popular in the west. They dislike them so much that they have started rumours, sent petitions, asked to have them removed from music performances, accused them of fraud. It also didn't help that the agency of one of these groups whose fans have been particularly nasty was found to have paid a broadcasting station to cut BTS performances whenever they were on, to never hire them to MC, and to allow very few ARMY in the recordings when they had a comeback on this particular broadcasting station. Music programs and music awards are neither fair nor balanced in Korea. When BTS finally started getting awards on their talent, suddenly the system was unfair. Awards and music programs couldn't get by with accepting payments from agencies to keep groups off shows or paying for their groups to win the most prestigious awards. Other fandoms couldn't stand the fact that they came from a tiny agency. In Korea most small agencies are corrupt. They're fronts for criminals and use their trainees for illegal activities. You'll also hear all the stories about how absolutely horrible ARMY as a fandom is. That's total bullshit. Want to know the first rule of being in ARMY? If you disparage other groups, if you start rumours that harm members of other groups, if you slander, you are permanently banned. All the shit that ARMY has been accused of, 99.99% has been traced back to antis, other fandoms. So if you hear that it is all the fault of Bangtan's fanclub from others who choose to reply that's balderdash and baloney. I'll just add this. Speaking as a Korean fan, Koreans are passionate when it comes to loving something or someone. Many of us are just batshit loonys. It's nothing new. Go take a look at when the Beatles played at Shea Stadium in New York. Elvis as well. Girls fainting, crying, tearing their hair and clothes. For every ARMY there is another person who loves another group just as passionately and some are quite willing to do anything to make a rival look bad.
